Announcement Collapse Jobs Migration done Update to the new ProBrewer Jobs system is complete -- find your next job at https://probrewer.com/jobs See more See less Experienced Head Brewer/Brewmaster Wanted - Miami, FL Collapse X Collapse Posts Latest Activity Photos Search Page of 1 Filter Time All Time Today Last Week Last Month Show All Discussions only Photos only Videos only Links only Polls only Events only Filtered by: Clear All new posts Previous template Next biscaynebay Registered User Join Date: Jul 2012 Posts: 1 Share Tweet #1 Experienced Head Brewer/Brewmaster Wanted - Miami, FL 03-06-2013, 11:08 AM Biscayne Bay Brewing Company, a brewery located in Miami, Florida is looking for a Brewmaster.  This is an exciting opportunity to be a leading brewer in a young and growing market.  With just one production brewery and two brewpubs in greater Miami, BBBC will provide a much needed local product of the highest quality to meet the expanding thirst of craft beer drinkers seeking local product. The ideal candidate will possess: •	Minimum of three (3) years of experience in a Commercial Production Brewery or High Volume Brew Pub. •	Minimum of an Associate’s Degree in a related technical field or a High School Diploma with three (3) years manufacturing experience in a brewery environment. •	Must have strong communication skills with good team dynamics and possess strong planning and organizational skills. •	Must have strong analytical and problem solving skills. •	Must have knowledge of recipe development. •	Must have a solid understanding of all aspects of brewing, cellaring, yeast handling, CIP and sanitizing. •	Must have a strong mechanical background with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve mechanical problems. •	Must have the ability to execute brewery preventative maintenance (PM) program. •	Should have prior packaging, bottling and racking experience. •	Should have a good understanding of Laboratory Operations /Quality Assurance /Quality Control, with a basic knowledge of chemistry and biology. •	Should have a strong work ethic and the ability to multitask. •	Should have self-motivation and the ability to work alone, as well as the ability to work efficiently as part of a team. •	Must be computer literate in spreadsheets and Microsoft Office. Job duties and responsibilities include: •	Oversee Final Equipment Installation •	Brew and oversee the brewing and packaging operations •	Recipe development •	Production scheduling •	Supervise lab work •	Maintain all brewing equipment including CIP and SIP •	Managing Assistant/Apprentice Brewers •	Inventory management •	Expansion plan development and implementation •	Educate tasting room staff on production and beer styles Brewery Details •	JV Northwest 3 vessel 15 barrel brewhouse. •	Annual expected production 2500 bbls. •	Tasting Room •	15,000 Sq.Ft. facility We are offering a competitive compensation package to match experience and education level.  Benefits package includes Relocation, Health Insurance, Paid Vacation/Holidays and a bonus structure that will keep the team motivated and share in the success of the brewery. Living in Downtown Miami Truly electrifying and uniquely refreshing, Downtown Miami is a special place to call home. With extensive and diverse living options, including more than 100 residential buildings, you’ll find something for everyone here – from the young professional to the growing family unit. When it comes to activities, there’s an equal wealth of choices waiting outside your door. Let us help you learn more about living in our ever-evolving, always-intriguing home. Whether you are a current resident or are looking to become one, we want to help you En Vogue with everything that is happening from the arts and food scenes to the ins outs of major projects transforming Downtown Miami. Doing Business in Downtown Miami As the Epicenter of the Americas, Downtown Miami connects our businesses and companies to the country – and the world – like no other U.S. city. Much like our vibrant and active residential community, the businesses and companies that call Downtown Miami home choose us to become part of something special and dynamic. We can help you, and your organization find your footing in our thriving city – and learn more about what the future holds in store for us all. Exploring Downtown Miami Life. Work. Adventure. No matter what brings you to Downtown Miami, you’ll never run out of options, ideas, or excursions to enjoy here. Iconic and inventive architecture, happening hotspots, energetic events to tropical escapes, and much more, you can find it all here, with us. We’re here to help you see and do everything you desire in Downtown Miami – and maybe even discover something you didn’t know you were looking for. The Miami Downtown Development Authority (Miami DDA) is an independent agency of the City of Miami funded by a special tax levy on properties within its district boundaries. The agency is governed by a 15-member board of directors, including three public appointees and 12 downtown property owners, business owners, and/or residents. The board sets policy direction, which is implemented by a multi-disciplinary team under the executive director's oversight. Our mission is to grow, strengthen, and promote the economic health and vitality of Downtown Miami. As an autonomous agency of the City, the Miami DDA advocates, facilitates, plans, and executes business development, planning, capital improvements, and marketing and communication strategies.
